website_summaries.verdict: Salomon developers seem to have done something quite spectacular in the Evasion 2 LTR. They managed to create a remarkably comfortable hiking shoe with outstanding sturdiness and a kind of fit that hugs the foot just right. The one thing that makes this gear a bit of a tough sell, however, is its subpar surface traction. All in all, the Evasion 2 LTR is yet another solid Salomon offering, especially for those who mostly hike on dry ground.
pros: Salomon’s Evasion 2 LTR received praises from numerous owners for its magnificently comfortable interior
The shoe’s glove-like fit left many users completely impressed
Its overall tough construction amazed a handful of wearers
One reviewer found the Evasion 2 LTR extremely light
This hiking gear was commended by a tester for having ultra-reliable heel support
Its reasonable price tag put a big smile on a buyer’s face
cons: A user lambasted its underwhelming grip performance on wet surfaces

customer_reviews.title: Snug fit
customer_reviews.text: These were to replace some worn out versions of the same shoe but a 1⁄2 size bigger. They’re very snug around the heel/ankle and I’m glad I took the 1⁄2 size step up. They’ve done probably 10 miles so far and no complaints.
customer_reviews.author: Westyman

customer_reviews.title: Sizing all wrong!!
customer_reviews.text: As with other reviewers sizing way out. I have narrow feet & noted other shoppers comments. My old Merrells are 8, & packed out with extra leather inserts as they are quite wide but plenty long. Salomans are a 9.5 & are toe pinchers,even with medium thick tennis socks, so they're going back for a 10, fingers crossed that these fit as no 10.5s seem to be in stock. These are impressive walking shoes but 2 sizes (at least) out of whack.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J Davies

customer_reviews.title: Sizing way out
customer_reviews.text: Nice looking shoes and appear well made, but I take a size 8. I saw the reviews and ordered a size 9 but they were still too small, my toes hitting the front of the shoe. I don't have a broad foot but they were also way too narrow for comfort and had to be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Tiger 100

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: I always buy salomon boots as they wear in well and are good quality, these are also very good although the heel padding is a bit tighter than the previous version and perhaps a touch narrower.
customer_reviews.author: NigelW

customer_reviews.title: Chuffed with these.
customer_reviews.text: They are a snug fit, so don’t expect to fit in with thick socks on. Perfect with thin ankle socks on for summer hikes. They’re pretty well insulated any way. I ordered an 8.5 normally having 8 or 8.5. 8 would have been too small. Great pair of shoes.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Huxley

customer_reviews.title: Too tight for the exact size
customer_reviews.text: I chose the exact size I usually ware but this pair is too tight for me 🤷‍♂️ Probably a half size up will fit better.
customer_reviews.author: Vasil Peev

customer_reviews.title: I found your pre order sizing very good
customer_reviews.text: Bit hard on the feet the first day but after that perfect 👌
customer_reviews.author: Carol Bennett

customer_reviews.title: Small fitting
customer_reviews.text: Looks an excellent shoe but had to return shoe is sized very small.
customer_reviews.author: Reggie Hewitt

customer_reviews.title: Great boots but too small
customer_reviews.text: Suggest you buy a size larger than you need as these are small for the stated size.
customer_reviews.author: Freddo

customer_reviews.title: Go at least a size up
customer_reviews.text: Normally take a 91/2 probably needed an 11 in these
customer_reviews.author: Alan West

customer_reviews.title: Excellent shoes.
customer_reviews.text: They fit great and have survived some tough conditions. Overall, very good.
customer_reviews.author: William A.

customer_reviews.title: Great shoes sizing tends to be small
customer_reviews.text: Really nice shoe. Very comfortable. I've always had great mileage from all the Salomon shoes and boots I have had. Just wish I could wear them at work 😉 Just be aware I'm normally a 9 and always buy Salomon in 10 as their sizing appears to be smaller.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Size up and not waterproof
customer_reviews.text: Take advice from reviewers. The shoe were really comfortable and light to try. I read that it was necessary to go up one size and I did with some reserve but it was spot on. Also the description says they are waterproof, they are not. I contacted Salomon and they say they put GTX (Gore-Tex) in the title if they are. So I returned them because of that otherwise I would have kept them.
customer_reviews.author: Sheepdog

customer_reviews.title: Poor workmanship.
customer_reviews.text: I initially I loved this shoe but 2 months of light use then this happened, I’m gutted, £100 spent & this workmanship is awful. Very Dissapointed. I would like a replacement to see if it is a One-Off but my return window is closed. What do I do❓
customer_reviews.author: PASQUALE D'ALESSIO

customer_reviews.title: Get a size bigger, they run small!
customer_reviews.text: These run a size small so order next size up. Very comfortable and so far totally waterproof. No issues at all with these.
customer_reviews.author: David J. Bryden

customer_reviews.title: Too small!
customer_reviews.text: Look well made but sizing is a problem. I'm size 8 and ordered size 8.5 but they were still too small so had to return them
customer_reviews.author: David C.

customer_reviews.title: Shoes taper aggressively from both sides making for a poor fit over toes.
customer_reviews.text: The shoes were the right length and fitted my foot - except for my big toes. My feet are relatively straight along my insole and I wear normal trainers etc with no problems. These shoes pushed hard against my big toes, creating a pressure spot within 30 seconds of putting them on. Do not buy these if you have a large toe, they will not fit.
customer_reviews.author: MR JE BOTHA

product_meta.title: SALOMON Men's Evasion 2 Ltr Low Rise Hiking Boots
product_meta.description: EVASION 2 LTR footwear combines the advantages of split leather with the best technical characteristics to offer durability, comfort and lightness in your walks in the middle of nature. - PROTECTION – The reinforced forefoot protects your feet on the roughest terrains. - SOLE - The resistant material and lug pattern of the Contagrip sole offer exceptional grip on all surfaces. - COMFORT– Energy Cell padded midsole and Ortholite insole ensure maximum comfort all day long. -LIGHTWEIGHT- Enjoy lightweight footwear (385g) for hiking.
feature_bullets: Split Suede Leather - Extremely durable and waterproof.
Textile Upper - Allows air to permeate the exterior providing breathability.
Leather Toe Cap - Protection for the front of the foot and shoe.
Heel Pull-Loop - For an easy on-and-off action of the shoe.
Injected EVA - Superb for cushioning as well as support.
